alert.note: Alert for Carolina (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 05 at 4:40PM AST by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM AST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Puerto Rico, including the following, Carolina, San Juan and Trujillo Alto. * WHEN...Until 645 PM AST. * IMPACTS...Overflowing poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 438 PM AST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Emergency managers reported urban flooding across the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will cause the flooding to continue. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
